content.prompt: Which of the following is the most likely immediate effect of an increase in runoff containing cadmium on the trophic structure of the river community?

choices.label: The population of Cladophora will decrease, resulting in an increase in the trout population.
There will be a large decrease in the trout population, resulting in an increase in damselfly nymphs.
Increased stream volume will provide more area for the trout to reproduce, causing a large increase in the population of algae.
The population of trout will decrease because the population of damselfly nymphs will decline.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
